children.value: Heuristic evaluation of Conautral ecommerce site

I ran a heuristic evaluation using Jakob Nielsen's 10 general principles for interaction design. They are called "heuristics" because they are broad rules of thumb and not specific usability guidelines. A heuristic evaluation was used to predict areas of the website where users may struggle to achieve their goals. Ensuring your website is usable is key to growth, user retention and user satisfaction.
Nielsen's Usability Heuristics:
Visibility of system status
Match bw system + real world
User control and freedom
Consistency and standards
Error prevention
Recognition rather than recall
Flexibility and efficiency of use
Aesthetic and minimalist design
Help users recognise, diagnose, and recover from errors
Help and documentation
The heuristic audit on Conatural found 54 violations of UX best practice. The shopping cart page violated most of the usability heuristics.
Examples of how the heurstics were violated
Visibility of system status (4/4 pages failed)
a. The navigation list on the homepage does not have a hover state.
b. When users click on a product, there is no feedback for the user to show there will be a change of state.
c. In the product page, when you hover over the ‘add to cart’ button there is no change to the button.
Match between system + real world (3/4 pages failed)
a. In the product page there is no description text to explain what the social media links are for.
b. In the shopping cart page, it is not clear what the x is for. It is helpful to write delete, or delete accompanied by the x.

User control and freedom (3/4 pages failed)
a. If users accidentally delete an item from their cart, there is no way to undo this.

Consistency and standards (4/4 pages failed)
a. In the shopping cart page, the product images are different sizes.
b. Lack of consistency between the different product pages, some products have star ratings and some don’t.

Error prevention (2/4 pages failed)
a. The search functionality does not do anything to prevent the user from searching for a product the site doesn’t sell.

Recognition rather than recall  (3/4 pages failed)
a. In the product page, when a user adds multiple items into their cart, it does not provide a subtotal for them in the same page.

Flexibility and efficiency of use  (3/4 pages failed)
a. Provide users with an ability to save an item to their wish list so that they can come back later and make a purchase.

Aesthetic and minimalist design (4/4 pages failed)
a. The social media links and the conceptual rewards button which are bright in colour should be removed as they can be distracting.

Help and documentation  (2/4 pages failed)
a. Not clear how the user can get help on an order. Contact us and FAQ link are not provided in a clear way.

export const _frontmatter = {"title":"Heuristic evaluation of Conautral ecommerce site","slug":"I ran an expert review of Conautral's website.","featureImage":"pastel.jpg","excerpt":"How does the Conatural ecommerce website measure up to the standardized UX heuristics."}

{`Heuristic evaluation of Conautral ecommerce site`}

{`I ran a heuristic evaluation using Jakob Nielsen's 10 general principles for interaction design. They are called "heuristics" because they are broad rules of thumb and not specific usability guidelines. A heuristic evaluation was used to predict areas of the website where users may struggle to achieve their goals. Ensuring your website is usable is key to growth, user retention and user satisfaction.`}

{`Nielsen's Usability Heuristics:`}
  1. {`Visibility of system status`}
  2. {`Match bw system + real world `}
  3. {`User control and freedom `}
  4. {`Consistency and standards`}
  5. {`Error prevention`}
  6. {`Recognition rather than recall `}
  7. {`Flexibility and efficiency of use `}
  8. {`Aesthetic and minimalist design `}
  9. {`Help users recognise, diagnose, and recover from errors`}
  10. {`Help and documentation `}

{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}

{`The heuristic audit on Conatural found 54 violations of UX best practice. The shopping cart page violated most of the usability heuristics. `}

{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}

{`Examples of how the heurstics were violated`}

  1. {`Visibility of system status (4/4 pages failed)`}

    {`a. The navigation list on the homepage does not have a hover state.`}

    {`b. When users click on a product, there is no feedback for the user to show there will be a change of state.`}

    {`c. In the product page, when you hover over the ‘add to cart’ button there is no change to the button.`}

  1. {`Match between system + real world (3/4 pages failed)`}

    {`a. In the product page there is no description text to explain what the social media links are for.`}

    {`b. In the shopping cart page, it is not clear what the x is for. It is helpful to write delete, or delete accompanied by the x.`}

  2. {`User control and freedom (3/4 pages failed) a. If users accidentally delete an item from their cart, there is no way to undo this. `}

  3. {`Consistency and standards (4/4 pages failed) a. In the shopping cart page, the product images are different sizes. b. Lack of consistency between the different product pages, some products have star ratings and some don’t.`}

  4. {`Error prevention (2/4 pages failed) a. The search functionality does not do anything to prevent the user from searching for a product the site doesn’t sell.`}

  5. {`Recognition rather than recall (3/4 pages failed) a. In the product page, when a user adds multiple items into their cart, it does not provide a subtotal for them in the same page.`}

  6. {`Flexibility and efficiency of use (3/4 pages failed) a. Provide users with an ability to save an item to their wish list so that they can come back later and make a purchase.`}

  7. {`Aesthetic and minimalist design (4/4 pages failed) a. The social media links and the conceptual rewards button which are bright in colour should be removed as they can be distracting.`}

  8. {`Help and documentation (2/4 pages failed) a. Not clear how the user can get help on an order. Contact us and FAQ link are not provided in a clear way.`}
